number.spec_description: A number is a single numerical value.

description.description: A description of this field.

source_quote.description: The exact FULL quotation if the NAME value is directly stated in the paper. Use this OR derivation (not both). If value requires calculation from multiple sources, use derivation instead. Separate multiple quotes with ' ... '.

derivation.description: Use instead of source_quote when NAME value requires calculation from multiple sources. Document the operation, all contributing source quotes, and the computation formula.

operation.description: The mathematical or logical operation performed to derive the value

operation_description.description: Human-readable explanation of what was calculated and why

sources.description: All source quotes that contributed to this derivation

location.description: Where this quote appears (page, table, section)

extracted_value.description: The numeric value extracted from this quote

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote or primary source for derivation

value.description: DESCRIPTION. The value of the NAME must be a number.

number_list.spec_description: A number_list is a list of numbers.

description.description: A description of this field.

source_quote.description: The exact FULL quotation if the NAME_list value is directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both). Separate multiple quotes with ' ... '.

derivation.description: Use instead of source_quote when value requires calculation from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

value.description: The value of the NAME_list must be a number.

unit.description: The unit of this value in NAME_list.

unit_number.spec_description: A unit_number is a single number with a prescribed unit. Only use this type if the value is likely to have a known unit, conversions are not easy so select a unit that is most likely to be used.

description.description: A description of this field.

unit.description: The unit that this number will likely have.

source_quote.description: The exact FULL quotation if the NAME value is directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both). Separate multiple quotes with ' ... '.

derivation.description: Use instead of source_quote when value requires calculation from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source

value.description: The value of the NAME with the following description: DESCRIPTION and the unit: UNIT.

unit_number_list.spec_description: A unit_number_list is a list of numbers with a prescribed unit. Only use this type if the value is likely to have a known unit, conversions are not easy so select a unit that is most likely to be used.

description.description: A description of this field.

unit.description: The unit that this number will likely have.

source_quote.description: The exact FULL quotation if the NAME_list value is directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both). Separate multiple quotes with ' ... '.

derivation.description: Use instead of source_quote when value requires calculation from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source

value.description: The value of the NAME_list with the following description: DESCRIPTION and the unit: UNIT.

fraction.spec_description: A fraction is a numerator and a denominator.

description.description: A description of this field.

numerator_source_quote.description: The exact quotation if NAME_numerator is directly stated. Use this OR numerator_derivation (not both).

numerator_derivation.description: Use instead of numerator_source_quote when numerator requires calculation.

numerator_source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_numerator_source_quote.

numerator.description: NUMERATOR. The numerator of the NAME with the following description: DESCRIPTION.

denominator_source_quote.description: The exact quotation if NAME_denominator is directly stated. Use this OR denominator_derivation (not both).

denominator_derivation.description: Use instead of denominator_source_quote when denominator requires calculation.

denominator_source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_denominator_source_quote

denominator.description: DENOMINATOR. The denominator of the NAME with the following description: DESCRIPTION.

categorical_value.spec_description: A categorical value is used to extract data that falls into predefined categories, such as types of diseases, genres of literature, or classifications of artifacts.

description.description: A description of the category.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if NAME is directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when NAME requires lookup/derivation from multiple locations.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

value.description: The category chosen from the NAME - DESCRIPTION with categories: CATEGORIES.

lat_lon_pair.spec_description: A coordinate pair extracts geographical or spatial data points, such as locations on a map or positions in a spatial experiment.

description.description: A description of what the coordinates represent.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if coordinates are directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when coordinates require lookup from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

latitude.description: Latitude part of the coordinate NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

longitude.description: Longitude part of the coordinate NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

lat_lon_pair_list.spec_description: A list of coordinate pairs extracts geographical or spatial data points, such as locations on a map or positions in a spatial experiment.

description.description: A description of what the coordinates represent.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if coordinates directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when coordinates require lookup.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

latitude.description: Latitude part of the coordinate NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

longitude.description: Longitude part of the coordinate NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

date.spec_description: A date is a specific point in time, such as a birthday, a historical event, or a deadline.

description.description: A description of the date.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if date directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when date requires lookup.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

year.description: The year of the date NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

month.description: The month of the date NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

day.description: The day of the date NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

date_list.spec_description: A list of dates is a collection of specific points in time, such as birthdays, historical events, or deadlines.

description.description: A description of the dates.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if date directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when date requires lookup.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

year.description: The year of the date with description: DESCRIPTION.

month.description: The month of the date with description: DESCRIPTION.

day.description: The day of the date with description: DESCRIPTION.

text_block.spec_description: A block of text, typically a paragraph or a set of paragraphs, used to extract larger narrative sections.

description.description: A description of the content to be extracted.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if NAME_value directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when text block requires assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

value.description: The extracted block of text with description: DESCRIPTION.

text_block_list.spec_description: A list of text blocks, used to extract multiple narrative sections or related text segments.

description.description: A description of the content to be extracted.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if NAME_value directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when text block requires assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

value.description: The extracted block of text with description: DESCRIPTION.

boolean_value.spec_description: A true or false value often used to answer yes/no questions or confirm the presence or absence of a feature.

description.description: A description of this field.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation supporting NAME_value. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when boolean value requires inference from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

value.description: True or False value representing NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

range_value.spec_description: A range value specifies a minimum and maximum of a measurable quantity, useful for extracting data where a span is significant, such as temperature ranges, age groups, or measurement tolerances.

description.description: A description of what the range represents.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the range values.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation if range directly stated. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when range requires calculation from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

min_value.description: The minimum value of the range with description: DESCRIPTION.

max_value.description: The maximum value of the range with description: DESCRIPTION.

effect_estimate.spec_description: An effect estimate captures a statistical measure of association (hazard ratio, odds ratio, risk ratio, incidence rate ratio, mean difference, etc.) with its confidence interval and p-value. Use for single comparisons like 'HR = 1.52 (95% CI: 1.12-2.08), p = 0.008'.

description.description: A description of what effect is being estimated and the comparison being made.

effect_type.description: The type of effect measure (e.g., HR, OR, RR, IRR, MD, SMD, beta).

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME effect estimate. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when effect estimate requires assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

point_estimate.description: The point estimate value (EFFECT_TYPE) for NAME with description: DESCRIPTION.

ci_lower.description: The lower bound of the confidence interval for NAME.

ci_upper.description: The upper bound of the confidence interval for NAME.

ci_level.description: The confidence level as a percentage (typically 95) for NAME.

p_value.description: The p-value for NAME (use -1 if reported as < threshold, e.g., p<0.001 = -0.001).

is_reference.description: True if this is the reference category (point_estimate typically 1.0 for ratios).

effect_estimate_list.spec_description: A list of effect estimates for multiple comparisons or groups. Use when extracting multiple HRs, ORs, etc. from the same analysis (e.g., multiple exposure levels vs reference).

description.description: A description of what effects are being estimated.

effect_type.description: The type of effect measure (e.g., HR, OR, RR, IRR, MD, SMD, beta).

tool.description: List of effect estimates (EFFECT_TYPE) for DESCRIPTION

source_quote.description: The exact quotation for this effect estimate. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when value requires calculation.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of this effect estimate

group_label.description: The label/name for this comparison group

ci_lower.description: The lower bound of the confidence interval

ci_upper.description: The upper bound of the confidence interval

is_reference.description: True if this is the reference category

measurement_with_error.spec_description: A measurement with associated uncertainty/error, such as '15.3 Â± 2.1 mm' or '42.5 (SE: 3.2)'. Use for single measurements with standard deviation, standard error, or other error terms.

description.description: A description of what is being measured.

error_type.description: The type of error (SD, SE, 95% CI, IQR, range).

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME measurement. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when measurement requires assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

value.description: The central/point value for NAME (DESCRIPTION) in UNIT.

error_lower.description: Lower bound if error is asymmetric (e.g., IQR, 95% CI). Use same as error_value if symmetric.

error_upper.description: Upper bound if error is asymmetric. Use same as error_value if symmetric.

measurement_with_error_list.spec_description: A list of measurements with associated uncertainty/error. Use when extracting multiple measurements with their error terms.

description.description: A description of what is being measured.

error_type.description: The type of error (SD, SE, 95% CI, IQR, range).

tool.description: List of measurements (DESCRIPTION) in UNIT with ERROR_TYPE

source_quote.description: The exact quotation for this measurement. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when value requires calculation.

source_location.description: The location in the paper

label.description: Label for this measurement (e.g., group name, time point)

sample_statistics.spec_description: Descriptive statistics for a sample including count, central tendency, and spread. Use for extracting summary statistics like 'n=42, mean 15.3 (SD 2.1)' or 'n=50, median 12 (IQR 8-16)'.

description.description: A description of the sample and what is being measured.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the variable.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME statistics. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when statistics require assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

mean.description: Mean value for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

sd.description: Standard deviation for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

se.description: Standard error for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

median.description: Median value for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

q1.description: First quartile/25th percentile for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

q3.description: Third quartile/75th percentile for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

min.description: Minimum value for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

max.description: Maximum value for NAME in UNIT (null if not reported).

sample_statistics_list.spec_description: A list of sample statistics for multiple groups or variables. Use when extracting summary statistics across multiple groups (e.g., treatment vs control).

description.description: A description of what is being measured across groups.

tool.description: List of sample statistics for DESCRIPTION in UNIT

source_quote.description: The exact quotation for these statistics. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when values require calculation.

source_location.description: The location in the paper

regression_coefficient.spec_description: A regression coefficient with standard error, confidence interval, and p-value. Use for extracting beta coefficients from linear, logistic, or other regression models.

description.description: A description of the predictor variable and outcome.

coefficient_type.description: The type of coefficient (beta, B, log-odds, etc.).

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME coefficient. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when coefficient requires assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

coefficient.description: The COEFFICIENT_TYPE coefficient value for NAME (DESCRIPTION).

se.description: Standard error of the coefficient for NAME.

ci_lower.description: Lower bound of confidence interval for NAME.

ci_upper.description: Upper bound of confidence interval for NAME.

t_statistic.description: T-statistic for NAME (null if not reported).

p_value.description: P-value for NAME (use -1 if reported as < threshold).

regression_coefficient_list.spec_description: A list of regression coefficients from a model. Use when extracting multiple predictors from the same regression analysis.

description.description: A description of the regression model and outcome.

coefficient_type.description: The type of coefficient (beta, B, log-odds, etc.).

tool.description: List of COEFFICIENT_TYPE coefficients from regression model for DESCRIPTION

source_quote.description: The exact quotation for this coefficient. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when value requires calculation.

source_location.description: The location in the paper

statistical_test.spec_description: A statistical test result including test statistic, degrees of freedom, and p-value. Use for chi-square, t-tests, F-tests, ANOVA, etc.

description.description: A description of what is being tested.

test_type.description: The type of statistical test (chi-square, t-test, F-test, Mann-Whitney, etc.).

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME test result. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when test result requires assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

test_statistic.description: The TEST_TYPE statistic value for NAME (DESCRIPTION).

df.description: Degrees of freedom for NAME (null if not applicable or not reported).

df_numerator.description: Numerator df for F-tests (null if not applicable).

df_denominator.description: Denominator df for F-tests (null if not applicable).

p_value.description: P-value for NAME (use -1 if reported as < threshold, e.g., p<0.001 = -0.001).

contingency_table_2x2.spec_description: A 2x2 contingency table for binary exposure and binary outcome. Use for extracting data needed for odds ratios, risk ratios, chi-square tests. Cells are: [exposed+outcome, exposed+no_outcome, unexposed+outcome, unexposed+no_outcome].

description.description: A description of the exposure and outcome being cross-tabulated.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME table data. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when cell counts require assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

exposed_label.description: The label for the exposed group in NAME (EXPOSURE_LABEL positive).

unexposed_label.description: The label for the unexposed group in NAME (EXPOSURE_LABEL negative).

outcome_positive_label.description: The label for positive outcome in NAME (OUTCOME_LABEL positive).

outcome_negative_label.description: The label for negative outcome in NAME (OUTCOME_LABEL negative).

a_exposed_outcome.description: Cell A for NAME (DESCRIPTION): Number with EXPOSURE_LABEL AND OUTCOME_LABEL.

b_exposed_no_outcome.description: Cell B for NAME: Number with EXPOSURE_LABEL but without OUTCOME_LABEL.

c_unexposed_outcome.description: Cell C for NAME: Number without EXPOSURE_LABEL but with OUTCOME_LABEL.

d_unexposed_no_outcome.description: Cell D for NAME: Number without EXPOSURE_LABEL and without OUTCOME_LABEL.

total_exposed.description: Total in EXPOSURE_LABEL group for NAME (a + b).

total_unexposed.description: Total in non-EXPOSURE_LABEL group for NAME (c + d).

named_number_set.spec_description: A flexible set of related named numbers extracted together from the same source. Use when you need to extract multiple related numeric values that don't fit standard statistical patterns, such as study characteristics, multiple time points, or custom metrics. Specify the expected field names in the description.

description.description: Description including the names and meanings of each number to extract (e.g., 'Extract: follow_up_months, total_n, dropout_n, completion_rate').

field_names.description: List of field names to extract (e.g., ['follow_up_months', 'total_n', 'dropout_n']).

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME values. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when values require assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

values_json.description: JSON object mapping field names to numeric values for NAME (DESCRIPTION). Expected fields: FIELD_NAMES. Example: {"field1": 10, "field2": 20.5}

proportion_with_ci.spec_description: A proportion or percentage with confidence interval. Use for prevalence, incidence rates, or any percentage with uncertainty bounds.

description.description: A description of what proportion is being reported.

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME proportion. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when proportion requires calculation from sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

proportion.description: The proportion (0-1) or percentage (0-100) for NAME (DESCRIPTION).

is_percentage.description: True if reported as percentage (0-100), False if proportion (0-1).

ci_lower.description: Lower bound of confidence interval for NAME.

ci_upper.description: Upper bound of confidence interval for NAME.

survival_analysis_result.spec_description: Results from survival/time-to-event analysis including median survival, rates at specific time points, and comparison statistics. Use for Kaplan-Meier, Cox regression summaries.

description.description: A description of the survival outcome and groups being compared.

time_unit.description: Unit of time for survival analysis (days, months, years).

source_quote.description: The exact quotation containing the NAME survival data. Use this OR derivation (not both).

derivation.description: Use when survival data requires assembly from multiple sources.

source_location.description: The location in the paper of the NAME_source_quote

group_label.description: Label for this group in NAME analysis (DESCRIPTION).

n_at_risk.description: Number at risk at start for NAME (DESCRIPTION).

median_survival.description: Median survival time in TIME_UNIT for NAME (null if not reached or not reported).

median_survival_ci_lower.description: Lower bound of CI for median survival in NAME.

median_survival_ci_upper.description: Upper bound of CI for median survival in NAME.

rate_at_timepoint.description: Survival/event rate at specific timepoint for NAME (0-1 or 0-100).

rate_timepoint.description: The timepoint in TIME_UNIT at which rate is measured for NAME.

log_rank_p.description: Log-rank test p-value for NAME comparison (null if not applicable).
